location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 20/7 'Muscat: British Consulate: Appointments and Movements of Staff (Political Agent)'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the back to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 202; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The file contains letters, telegrams, minutes, notes, and draft correspondence concerning the appointments and movements of staff at the Muscat Political Agency and Consulate. The correspondence deals with the granting of consular powers to the new appointee, and includes letters of appointment issued by the Foreign Office. These powers were requested by the Government of India and given by the King, via the Foreign Office. Other matters covered by the papers include:requests for official seals and signatures of appointeesdates of a tour of India taken by the Muscat Agent in November 1937arrangements for leave and appropriate coverpayment for travel costsquestions of salary scales, including a proposal from the Residency at Bushire to raise those of First Interpreters at Muscat, Kuwait, and Khorramshahr.The principal correspondents are the Political Agent and Consul at Muscat, Foreign Office, India Office, Government of India (Foreign Department), Office of the High Commissioner for India, Political Resident and Consul-General at Bushire, and the Ministry of War Transport.

name.namePart: Government of India, Foreign and Political Department
